messages.message: @Rafal @vineeth do we expect the model to be able to return a field in json format? (see josh’s custom prompt above)
@Atinder can you confirm on this? We havent supported such queries before in build mode. We usually expect key value pairs kind of queries. Not the ones where we format in json, markdown, etc
TLDR; chat and build are currently not the same, but ideally in the future they would converge

The reason is I want to format the table in refiner and I don’t see a way to do this with just key value pairs. If we can open it up to support questions or key value pair that would help build custom queries

Hey Josh, yep definitely it would help custom queries. Currently we dont have a concrete way to provide provenance for tables, or non key value pair kind of queries. Its one of the main reasons we still haven’t provided the same experience as the one for chat.
Can we add in a regex search for the time being that looks for a ? in the prompt to then ask a question versus a key value pair
just somethign that could be a lite lift
@vineeth what are the major differences between chat and build app model calls atm? this will help inform us on the product side how to set expectations. @avi @Varun Jain

Chat app vs build app:
1. chat app currently supports queries which can style the output as required json, html, markdown, (maybe even return answer as a poem :stuck_out_tongue: see image below), whereas build app supports only key value kind of queries.
2. Provenance is very weak in chat app, since the answers are free flowing and may not be extracted from a single place vs build app where we have better provenance since we are looking at particular values which is most often the case in most solutions we build.
3. Long docs are supported in chat app i.e we retrieve relevant chunks required to answer a user query vs no support currently for long docs in build mode.
Supporting evidence from doc for the above poem, in case anyone wants to verify :sweat_smile:
But i guess why can we not add a drop down in the field or add in a regex for a ? in it to convert to a question?

This can be done easily, however we wont have any provenance info correctly returned for the questions. The prompt we use for build uses line number and other matching techniques to drill down the provenance region for an extracted field.
yep totally fine to be honest but i dont want us to limit the prompt because prov tracking isnt figured out
Yep agree, will have to see if we have any bandwidth on this @Hari what do you think?
